is a small seaside town in
, around 30-40 km east of Havana. The beach apparently is not the nicest, however the town is relatively typically Cuban, there are many casas particulares and some nice restaurants.
Take Bus 400 from Havana for 0.40 CUP. It stops near the train station. Alternatively you can take a taxi for 20 CUC

value: - Their little hospital, downtown. Go and donate your vitamins, aspirin or other extra meds. If you are sick, go for excellent care. The staff are very devoted. For information on donation of medical supplies, see
- Pizza in wood-fired stove. Quirky, rustic decor, very homey. Excellent service. Small 'Zoo' on grounds.

content=Very good food, excellent chicken cordon bleu. Pizzas, lasagna right from the wood oven. Try the spaghetti bolognaise with cheese.
content=Very good food, good cordon bleu. Perfect lasagna en spaghetti with cheese cooked in woodoven. Nice and helpful staff

There are many casa particular. Just ask around!

If you are not into the hotel scene and want to see the real Cuba, Guanabo is the place to go. There is a bus to Havana, and also a train (2km south of town) in season. This is the electric 'Hershey Train', worth seeing for train buffs.
